instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3478: What is 820-3478? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3478</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> iMac 27" Thunderbolt ports not working
threads.message:
Got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3478</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board in off an iMac 27" 2013 today but neither of the thunderbolt ports will work. If I connect a monitor to either of them monitor is showing connected no signal but there are no mirroring options coming up. 
Is this likely to be burned <CHIP>U3210</CHIP> and <CHIP>U3310</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3478</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> iMac 27" Thunderbolt ports not working
threads.message:
Check if you get proper voltages on both Thunderbol vias, pages 30-32.
Is more likely a problem in a common area, than have both vias damaged.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3478</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> iMac 27" Thunderbolt ports not working
threads.message:
Think you are correct as with further visual inspection <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> looks discoloured like it has a burn mark on it. It's got like a brown spot on it. 
Is there a source for replacement <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> or it's a case of pulling one of a donor board only?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3478</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> iMac 27" Thunderbolt ports not working
threads.message:
Not idea reallu if is board dependant.
It has a TBT ROM separately.

You can try any, but always better to get from donor board, to be safe...
